comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Vor Frelsers Kirke, or Church of Our Savior.

comment.author: 68232573@N00
comment._content:
Made world famous by Jules Verne in his novel Journey to the Earths Core, because he lets his group of adventures stay over in Copenhagen for a few days and while they wait they spend the time exercising their ability to stand hights by climbing this tower.

Pure myth, but a dramatic story: 
The architecht threw himself from the tower when he found out that the twirl was against the clock and not, as he had drawn it, with the clock.

comment._content: here's my shot taken few weeks ago www.flickr.com/photos/27465106@N08/3384837653/in/set-7215...

comment.author: 20963518@N00
comment._content: Some years ago it was still possible to walk all the way to the top of the tower. At the top the footpath is only wide enough for one shoe. The trip is amazing. Sadly someone jumped from there. I guess it is closed now, but I'm really not sure. I'll check the next time I'm in CPH.
